name: Bicycle Crunch
steps: Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you and your arms by your sides.
Engage your core muscles and lean back slightly while simultaneously lifting your legs off the ground. Your body should form a V-shape.
Keep your back straight and your chest lifted.
Reach your arms forward parallel to your legs.
Hold the position for as long as you can, ideally for 30 to 60 seconds.
To release the pose, lower your legs and arms to the ground and rest for a few seconds.
comments: Keep your lower back pressed firmly into the ground throughout the exercise.
Keep your movements controlled and avoid using momentum to swing your legs.
Focus on twisting your torso to bring your elbow towards your opposite knee, rather than just lifting your shoulder towards your knee.
Keep your neck relaxed and avoid pulling on your head with your hands.
